facts.hoaIncludes: Common area maintenance, landscaping, security, community amenities
facts.waitingListNotes: Membership limited to property owners only
facts.golfCoursesNames: Mountains Course (Tom Fazio), Canyons Course (Arthur Hills)
facts.appreciationNotes: One of the most prestigious communities in the desert
facts.pros: Two championship courses, ultra-exclusive membership, stunning Santa Rosa mountain views, world-class amenities, privacy
facts.cons: Very high costs (HOA + membership dues = $3,500-4,300/month), limited inventory, no tee times means you must own to play
facts.bestFor: Ultra-high-net-worth individuals, serious golfers, celebrities seeking privacy and exclusivity
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, multiple real estate sources

facts.hoaIncludes: Full common area maintenance, landscaping, security
facts.waitingListNotes: Limited to 225 regular members + 45 associate members, very exclusive
facts.appreciationNotes: One of the world's most expensive golf memberships
facts.pros: Ultra-exclusive, Tom Fazio course, limited membership creates intimacy, A-list members
facts.cons: Extremely high costs ($500k initiation + $70k/year dues), long wait list, limited homes available ($5M-$42M)
facts.bestFor: Ultra-wealthy buyers seeking the absolute pinnacle of exclusivity and privacy
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025

facts.golfCoursesNames: Mountain Course and Desert Course, both Tom Fazio designs
facts.pros: Two exceptional Fazio courses, strong social scene, excellent amenities, prestigious address
facts.cons: High membership costs, by-invitation-only for property owners
facts.bestFor: Affluent golfers seeking a balance of exclusivity and active social community
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025

facts.hoaIncludes: 24-hour guard gate security, common area maintenance, landscaping (some neighborhoods include front/rear yard maintenance)
facts.shortTermRentalDetails: 30-day minimum rental period, HOA approval required, city permit needed
facts.golfCoursesNames: Pete Dye Stadium, Pete Dye Mountain, Pete Dye Dunes, Greg Norman, Nicklaus Tournament, Palmer Private, Palmer Public, Weiskopf Private, TPC Stadium
facts.pickleballReservationSystem: First-come first-served, or reserve via clubhouse app
facts.restaurantNames: The Grill at PGA West, Clubhouse Restaurant
facts.bestViewCorridors: Properties along Mountain View Drive, stadium course holes 16-18, Palmer Private fairway lots
facts.airportNoiseDetails: Occasional private jet traffic but minimal commercial aircraft
facts.golfCartPathDetails: Cart paths to La Quinta Village (shops, restaurants, Starbucks)
facts.socialCalendarNotes: Weekly mixers, monthly wine dinners, seasonal golf tournaments, social clubs
facts.appreciationNotes: Up 8% over past 24 months, strong demand due to variety of price points
facts.pros: 9 world-class courses, excellent resale value, vibrant social scene, golf cart to village, variety of price points ($400k-$3M+)
facts.cons: HOA fees add up with multiple communities, mixed age of homes, some areas show wear
facts.bestFor: Avid golfers, retirees and second-home buyers who want resort-style living with excellent golf and amenities
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, pgawest.com, multiple real estate sources

facts.hoaIncludes: Tennis, fitness center, pickleball, pools (17 different HOAs within gates, fees vary widely)
facts.pros: Affordable HOA fees, 27-hole course, resort-style amenities, fitness center, multiple pools, active community
facts.cons: 17 different HOAs creates confusion, golf not included in HOA, public course (not private)
facts.bestFor: Budget-conscious buyers seeking golf community lifestyle without high membership fees
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, hoa-ipcca.com

facts.hoaIncludes: Varies by property type - condos have higher fees including more services
facts.golfCoursesNames: North Course and South Course (both Ted Robinson designs)
facts.pros: Two quality golf courses, lower initiation than equity clubs, good social scene
facts.cons: Non-equity means no ownership stake, South course generally preferred over North
facts.bestFor: Golfers who want private club amenities without equity club costs
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, ironwoodcountryclub.com

facts.hoaIncludes: Premium cable, internet, 24-hour security, common grounds maintenance, access to all amenities except golf green fees
facts.golfCoursesNames: Two 18-hole golf courses (green fees separate from HOA)
facts.socialCalendarNotes: Over 80 clubs and groups, activities daily
facts.pros: Low HOA considering amenities (cable/internet included), two golf courses, 80+ clubs, completed community (no construction), exclusively single-family homes
facts.cons: 55+ age restriction, homes are 20+ years old (expect maintenance), limited nightlife/restaurants within community
facts.bestFor: Active adults 55+ seeking robust social calendar and affordable desert lifestyle with golf
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, 55places.com, scpdca.com

facts.hoaIncludes: Cable TV, internet, water, trash, insurance
facts.golfCoursesNames: Firecliff and Mountain View (both public daily-fee courses, not private)
facts.golfCartPathDetails: Direct golf cart access from The Retreat to Desert Willow courses
facts.pros: Discount golf membership for residents, direct cart access to courses, HOA includes many utilities, newer construction (The Retreat)
facts.cons: Public golf courses (not private), HOA fee is higher than some non-golf communities
facts.bestFor: Buyers seeking newer construction with golf access without private club membership requirements
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, desertwillow.com

facts.hoaIncludes: Varies by property type - condos include more services
facts.pros: Member-owned equity club, lower initiation than top-tier equity clubs, solid golf course
facts.cons: Single course (some members want variety), condo HOA fees are high
facts.bestFor: Buyers seeking equity club membership at more accessible price point than Bighorn/Vintage
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, indianridgecc.com

facts.waitingListNotes: Preview membership available - 6 months at just monthly dues before committing to full initiation
facts.golfCoursesNames: Two 18-hole Jack Nicklaus Signature Golf Courses
facts.pros: Two Nicklaus signature courses, preview membership option, lower initiation than Bighorn/Madison, Indian Wells location
facts.cons: Still high costs compared to non-equity clubs, limited to 550 golf members
facts.bestFor: Golfers who want Jack Nicklaus courses and equity club benefits at mid-tier pricing
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, toscanacc.com, wojdylogolf.com

facts.shortTermRentalDetails: Short-term rentals (under 30 days) are banned by HOA. Seasonal rentals of 30+ days are still permitted.
facts.pros: Central Palm Desert location, established community, monthly rentals still allowed
facts.cons: Cannot do vacation/short-term rentals (under 30 days), single course
facts.bestFor: Buyers seeking traditional country club living without vacation rental income expectations
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, pdcca.com, City of Palm Desert STR regulations

facts.hoaIncludes: Cable TV, internet, guard/controlled access, clubhouse and amenities access
facts.shortTermRentalDetails: Short-term rentals allowed, some HOA fees apply directly
facts.pros: Low HOA including cable/internet, 36-hole golf, 20-acre lake with kayaking, non-age-restricted, family-friendly, allows STRs
facts.cons: Further south in Indio (not Palm Desert/Indian Wells), less walkable to retail
facts.bestFor: Families, retirees, golf enthusiasts seeking affordable desert living with short-term rental income potential
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, 55places.com, kwcoachellavalley.com

facts.hoaIncludes: Among the lowest maintenance fees in Coachella Valley, common grounds, amenities access
facts.golfCoursesNames: Two 18-hole golf courses (green fees separate from HOA)
facts.socialCalendarNotes: Extensive clubs and activities, very active community
facts.pros: Very low HOA fees ($369/month), two golf courses, restaurant on-site, active 55+ community, newer than Sun City PD
facts.cons: 55+ age restriction, Indio location (farther south), vacation rentals visible on platforms but verify HOA rules
facts.bestFor: Active adults 55+ seeking low-cost desert living with golf and activities
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, 55places.com, scshca.com

facts.waitingListNotes: Membership by invitation only, not tied to real estate ownership, maximum 425 golf memberships
facts.pros: Historic club (built 1957), invitation-only exclusivity, NOT tied to real estate (can be member without owning), Indian Wells location
facts.cons: Invitation required with member sponsorship, limited memberships (425 max), high annual dues
facts.bestFor: Well-connected buyers seeking prestigious membership separate from property ownership
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, eldoradocc.org, multiple real estate sources

facts.hoaIncludes: Social/Fitness/Tennis Membership, Cable TV, Earthquake Insurance, Security, landscape, exterior maintenance, trash, 24-hour alarm monitoring
facts.pros: Extremely low golf initiation ($10k), social membership included in HOA, 15 tennis courts, 27-hole course, clubhouse amenities
facts.cons: HOA is high ($771-$1690/month), food/beverage minimum ($700/season), new homeowner reserve fee (9x monthly HOA)
facts.bestFor: Buyers wanting country club lifestyle with very affordable golf membership and social amenities included
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, thelakescc.com, issuu.com membership fee document

facts.hoaIncludes: Low HOA fees mentioned but specific amount not found
facts.pros: Palm Springs location, public golf (no membership required), low HOA, golf club separate from HOA, annual golf club membership only $399
facts.cons: Golf club unaffiliated with residential HOA, public course (not private), limited data available
facts.bestFor: Buyers seeking Palm Springs address with golf access but no membership requirements
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, escenagolf.com

facts.hoaIncludes: Varies by property type - Bungalows have higher fees
facts.waitingListNotes: Maximum 450 golf memberships, membership required with property purchase
facts.golfCoursesNames: Two 18-hole courses (36 holes total): one by Clive Clark, one by Pete Dye
facts.pros: Two distinct championship courses (Clark + Dye), luxurious clubhouse, 3,000-bottle wine cellar, fitness/spa, gourmet dining
facts.cons: High costs (HOA $600-965 + $175k initiation + $3,205/month dues), membership required with purchase
facts.bestFor: Serious golfers wanting two quality courses and upscale amenities in La Quinta
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, hideawaygolfclub.com, countryclubmag.com

facts.hoaIncludes: Social and fitness amenities, all resort lifestyle amenities except golf
facts.pros: Includes social/fitness in HOA, golf membership not required, La Quinta location, several affordable golf plans available
facts.cons: Very high HOA ($1,175/month), slower resale, high property values ($1.6M-$4.3M)
facts.bestFor: Affluent buyers seeking resort lifestyle with optional golf in La Quinta
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, countryclubinfo-laquinta.com

facts.hoaIncludes: Cable TV/internet, on-site security, trash
facts.golfCoursesNames: Stone Eagle Golf Club is within development but NOT associated with HOA (separate, invitation-only membership)
facts.pros: Low HOA for luxury community ($575/month), NOT required to join golf club, cable/internet included, 24-hour guard gate, only 43 homes (very exclusive)
facts.cons: Golf membership is separate and invitation-only ($18k/year), limited inventory (43 homes total), slower resale
facts.bestFor: Ultra-wealthy buyers seeking privacy and exclusivity without golf membership requirements

facts.hoaIncludes: Common area maintenance, security, landscaping
facts.golfCoursesNames: Tom Weiskopf-Jay Morrish designed championship course
facts.pros: World-class golf course, Tom Weiskopf design, extensive amenities, strong social calendar
facts.cons: Very high initiation fee ($200k-250k), high monthly dues ($22k-37k annually), variation in reported costs
facts.bestFor: Serious golfers and ultra-wealthy buyers seeking top-tier country club lifestyle

facts.hoaIncludes: Front yard landscaping, 24/7 manned gate, internet, cable, maintenance
facts.golfCoursesNames: Public pay-as-you-play course ($3,200 single/$4,350 couple annual pass)
facts.pros: Social/fitness membership included with home, no mandatory golf membership, extensive amenities, 21,000 sq ft clubhouse
facts.cons: Transfer fee at closing ($3,312), HOA fees have increased over time
facts.bestFor: Active 55+ buyers who want resort-style amenities without expensive golf club dues

facts.hoaIncludes: Common area maintenance, landscaping
facts.pros: Lower HOA fees ($160-245/month), 25,000 sq ft clubhouse, 25% of homes allow all ages, extensive amenities
facts.cons: Club membership initiation ($12,500 if not transferred), 75% homes require 55+

facts.hoaIncludes: Common area maintenance, pool/spa maintenance, landscaping
facts.pros: 11 pools/spas, beautiful greenbelts, hiking on-site, close to El Paseo, lower price point for South Palm Desert
facts.cons: Non-gated, older homes (1978-79), higher HOA for condo ($475-525/month)

facts.hoaIncludes: No HOA
facts.pros: NO HOA fees, large custom lots (average 5 acres), equestrian facilities possible, close to El Paseo and Bighorn, country setting
facts.cons: Non-gated, wide range of home ages and conditions, slower resale, rural setting may not appeal to all
facts.bestFor: Buyers seeking large custom estates without HOA fees, equestrian enthusiasts, privacy-focused buyers

facts.hoaIncludes: Common area maintenance, security, landscaping (custom homes $615/month, villas $1,535/month)
facts.pros: Arnold Palmer design, 1920s Spanish Colonial architecture, renovated clubhouse (2020), historic gardens, excellent golf program
facts.cons: Very high costs ($180k initiation + $58k annual dues + $11.5k capital fee), social membership also expensive ($50k + $24k annual)

facts.hoaIncludes: Common area maintenance, security, landscaping
facts.golfCoursesNames: Tom Fazio 18-hole championship (7,083 yards) + 10-hole short course (Quarry Ranch)
facts.bestViewCorridors: Properties on elevated lots, 300ft elevation change throughout course
facts.pros: Tom Fazio design, no tee times required, Top 100 Golf Community (Travel & Leisure), 21,000 sq ft clubhouse built into quarry wall, dramatic elevation changes
facts.cons: High costs ($120k-145k initiation + $30k-41.5k annual dues), limited inventory
facts.bestFor: Serious golfers seeking Tom Fazio design and no-tee-time freedom in exclusive setting

facts.hoaIncludes: Social membership, clubhouse access, fitness center, 9 tennis courts, 8 pickleball courts, bocce, landscaping, trash, DirecTV, high-speed internet, 24-hour guard gate

facts.pros: Two championship courses, lower golf initiation ($39.5k new option vs $115k), social membership included in HOA, 23,000 sq ft clubhouse, extensive amenities
facts.cons: High HOA fees ($660-1,198/month varies by association), monthly golf dues ($1,570) on top of HOA
facts.bestFor: Golfers wanting two courses and full country club lifestyle with more accessible membership pricing

facts.hoaIncludes: Social & fitness membership, 24-hr guard gate, internet/cable, tennis, dining, dog park, fitness center, pickleball, driving range
facts.pros: Low golf initiation ($5k-10k), social membership included in HOA, driving range included, affordable entry to private golf
facts.cons: Older community (built 1969), monthly golf dues ($1,044) add up
facts.bestFor: Golfers seeking affordable private club entry with social amenities included

facts.hoaIncludes: Unlimited golf on Par 3 course, trash, cable TV, common area maintenance
facts.pros: Golf included in HOA ($396-440/month), no separate initiation fee, affordable 55+ community, manufactured homes with ownership of common grounds
facts.cons: Manufactured home community (not traditional construction), older community, Par 3 course only (not full 18-hole)

facts.hoaIncludes: Social membership, fitness center, croquet, pickleball, yoga, bridge, aquatics, bocce, tennis
facts.pros: Unlimited golf included ($2,700/year), 14 pools/spas, newly renovated clubhouse, mid-century modern architecture, year-round golf programs
facts.cons: High total monthly cost ($1,331 HOA + $335 LID + $225 golf = $1,891), $40k-50k affiliation fee at closing, land encumbrance until 2042

facts.hoaIncludes: Social membership, cable TV, high-speed WiFi, fitness center, health spa, grounds/exterior maintenance, roof, pest control
facts.restaurantNames: Full-service restaurant and bar (20% off for residents)
facts.pros: 35 pools/spas, 27-hole golf course (Golf Digest rated), no golf initiation fee, preferred tee times for owners, full spa services, short-term rentals allowed
facts.cons: Land lease fee ($187/month) on Indian Leased Land (extended to 2069), high total monthly cost ($954 HOA + $187 lease = $1,141)
facts.bestFor: Golfers and resort-lifestyle buyers seeking extensive amenities with STR potential

facts.hoaIncludes: 24-hour guard gate, internet/cable (Verizon FiOS), lake maintenance, pool/tennis upkeep, boat club access for off-lake homes, grounds
facts.pros: Unique 25-acre private lake, electric boating/kayaking/fishing, boat club for off-lake homes, bocce, BBQ area, private park
facts.cons: Higher HOA for waterfront ($450-533/month), only electric boats allowed, premium pricing for lakefront
facts.bestFor: Buyers seeking unique water-oriented lifestyle in desert with boating and fishing
facts.dataSource: Web research Nov 2025, lakelaquinta.com, yourresorthome.com, multiple sources

facts.hoaIncludes: Front yard landscaping, semi-annual flower replacement, cable TV, high-speed internet, digital phone with unlimited long-distance, street maintenance, guard gate
facts.pros: Social membership required but included in HOA, extensive cable/internet/phone package included
facts.cons: Mandatory social membership ($5k + $724/month), optional golf very expensive ($31k + $1,819/month), high total costs

facts.hoaIncludes: Common area maintenance, security, landscaping

facts.pros: Newer community, pastoral mountain-view setting, no golf course (lower costs), tree-lined streets with split rail fences
facts.cons: Higher HOA for non-golf community ($654/month), no golf course amenities

facts.cons: Older community (1985), non-equity club, condos only (1-3 bed, 1,342-2,148 sqft)

facts.hoaIncludes: Social membership, cable, internet, trash, roof maintenance, exterior painting, 24-hour guard gate and security patrol
facts.pros: Low golf initiation for residents ($5k vs $17.5k non-residents), social membership included in HOA, roof maintenance included
facts.cons: High monthly total ($775-936 HOA + $1,025 golf = $1,800-1,961), monthly golf dues

facts.hoaIncludes: Varies by neighborhood - both gated and non-gated communities
facts.pros: Frank Sinatra's home course, historic club (established 1952), celebrity history (Jack Benny, George Burns, Marx Brothers), Premier Golf $25k initiation
facts.cons: High annual dues ($25,400/year = $2,117/month), HOA varies by neighborhood, non-gated areas available

facts.hoaIncludes: Common area maintenance

facts.hoaIncludes: Exterior maintenance, landscaping, cable, trash, guard gate security, 4 community pools/spas, clubhouse access (varies by neighborhood)

facts.hoaIncludes: Social/gym membership, cable TV, common area maintenance

facts.hoaIncludes: Common area maintenance, security, landscaping
